list_definition.definition: a large number of men armed and organized for war

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The two armies met at dawn.

list_ex_of_english: Especially horrific were 1796, 1799, 1805, 1809, and 1813-15, for it was then that the biggest armies were present for longest.
Voluntary enlistment in the royalist armies is also highlighted as a route to freedom.
The army's offensive operation quickly gave way to attrition.
The fear of standing armies went hand-in-hand with the fear of a corruption of the body politic.
At the same time the chief of the army's general staff had gained confidence in his own success.
The resulting instability would ensure rule by vast standing armies.
The salt voucher system thus provided a means whereby merchants supplying frontier armies in the northwest ultimately received reimbursement in bronze coin.
The army's political power distorted rights protection and market fairness.
